snippet: Many people in New York City said they would survive the ban on large sweetened drinks, although they might be a bit parched this summer.
abstract: Most people in New York City say the daily impact on their lives because of Mayor Michael R Bloomberg's plans to ban large sweetened drinks, would be minimal, though the implications are unnerving; in fact, for food-loving New Yorkers, next summer could be a thirsty one, as the proposed ban doesn’t apply only to slushies and sodas, served in Big Gulps and the like.
lead_paragraph: Many people in New York City said they would survive the ban on large sweetened drinks, although they might be a bit parched this summer.

headline.seo: Debating the Proposed City Regulation on Drink Size
headline.main: Imagining a Smaller Drink for a Big, Thirsty City
headline.print_headline: Imagining a Smaller Drink for a Big, Thirsty City
